page.title: 01General Description
page.content: The three villages of{Frogmore, {Sherford and Chillington}are in the heart of{South Devon}known as {the South Hams}which are situated between the {Rivers Avon and Dart. } Traditionally, it is a farming area with fertile land and a mild climate. Until recently the land was used mainly for sheep and dairying but during the past few years the emphasis has changed to cereals and other crops. {This disc}has been contributed by children from two schools. Those from Chillington go to the Area Primary School at Stokenham and those from Frogmore and Sherford to the small village school at West Charleton. This is a very unspoilt, beautiful and peaceful place in which to live - still part of "England's green and pleasant land".
